TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LocalServiceSecuritySettings extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides local service security properties that can be set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class contains the local security settings used by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement> to build the security channel. These settings are local to the service and are not represented in the service's security policy.
## Examples This example shows how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalServiceSecuritySettings> class to change the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalServiceSecuritySettings.DetectReplays%2A> setting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan InactivityTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.InactivityTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the duration to wait before the channel is closed due to inactivity.
Docs.value: A that represents the duration to wait before the security session with the client is closed due to inactivity. The default is 2 minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a secure conversation session, note that both this property and the `ReceiveTimeout` property on the binding affect session timeout. The shorter of the two determines when timeouts occur.
Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:
- All client credential types for <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSDualHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is enabled.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> = `true` or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.Windows%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> = `true`.
Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding>.
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.ClientCertificate%2A> = `true` or with none of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> properties set to `true`.
## Examples This example shows how get the `InactivityTimeout` value.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The property is set to a value less than 0.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the lifetime for the that the service issues for the client.
Docs.value: A that represents the lifetime for new security cookies. The default is 10 hours.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of s that the service allows to cache at once.
Docs.value: The maximum number of secure conversation cookies that can be cached by the service. When this limit is reached the service removes the oldest cached secure conversation cookies to make room for new secure conversation cookies. The default is 1000.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.
Docs.value: A that represents the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating. The default is 5 minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value for this property is 5 minutes.
Messages that do not pass the send-time test are rejected.
This property is used in conjunction with the message timestamp verification and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalClientSecuritySettings.ReplayWindow%2A> property.
## Examples This example shows how to get the `MaxClockSkew` value.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#6)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#6)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent security negotiations with clients that the service can participate in.
Docs.value: The maximum number of concurrent security negotiations with clients that the service can participate in. The default is 128.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Negotiation sessions in excess of this limit are rejected and a SOAP fault is sent back to the client. The client typically must retry later, which allows some time for existing negotiations on the service to complete.
## Examples This example shows how set the `MaxStatefulNegotiations` value.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#8)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#8)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration of the security negotiation phase between client and service.
Docs.value: A that represents the maximum duration of the security negotiation phase between client and service. Any negotiation with the service (for example during message level SPNego or SSL authentication) must complete within this time. The default is 1 minute.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this limit is exceeded, an exception is thrown.
## Examples This example shows how to get the value of this property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures.
Docs.value: if security sessions attempt to reconnect after transport failures; otherwise . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this flag is set to `true`, the service allows the client to send messages that correspond to a single security session over multiple transport connections. This is useful in the case of secure WS-ReliableMessaging because the client requires the session to tolerate transient transport failures.
## Examples This example shows how to get the value of this property.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#10)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ReplayCacheSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ReplayCacheSize : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the nonce cache used for replay detection.
Docs.value: The size of the nonce cache used for replay detection. The default is 900,000.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A nonce is a "number used once".
If the nonce count is exceeded, the incoming message is rejected and a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException> is thrown. Old nonces are removed in a timely manner.
## Examples This example shows how to get the value of this property.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#11)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#11)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan ReplayWindow { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.ReplayWindow : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time within which the service can accept a message.
Docs.value: A that represents the maximum amount of time within which the service can accept a message. The default is 5 minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A nonce is a "number used once".
The service rejects all messages that are sent more than the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalServiceSecuritySettings.ReplayWindow%2A> duration in the past. Messages that arrive within the `ReplayWindow` have their nonce checked for uniqueness.
## Examples This example shows how to get the value of this property.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#12)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#12)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan SessionKeyRenewalInterval { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.SessionKeyRenewalInterval : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the lifetime of a key used in a security session. When this interval expires the key is automatically renewed.
Docs.value: The time span after which the service requires that the initiator renew the key used for the security session. If the initiator does not renew the key within this time the service sends back a fault to the initiator. The default is 15 hours.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:
- All client credential types for <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSDualHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is enabled.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> = `true` or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.Windows%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> = `true`.
Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding>.
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.ClientCertificate%2A> = `true` or with none of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> properties set to `true`.
## Examples This example shows how get the value of this property.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#13)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#13)]

Docs.exception: The property is set to a value less than 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan SessionKeyRolloverInterval { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.SessionKeyRolloverInterval : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time interval after key renewal for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal.
Docs.value: The time interval after key renewal for which the previous session key is valid on incoming messages after a key renewal. The default is 5 minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After key renewal, the client and server should always send messages using the most current available key. Both parties can accept incoming messages secured with the previous session key until the rollover time expires.
Session settings such as this one are applicable under any of the following conditions:
- All client credential types for <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSDualHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is enabled.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> = `true` or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.Windows%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> = `true`.
Session settings such as this one are not applicable under any of the following conditions:
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding>.
- For <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding>.
- If [\<reliableSession> element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9c93818a-7dfa-43d5-b3a1-1aafccf3a00b) is not enabled, on <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.ClientCertificate%2A> = `true` or with none of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> properties set to `true`.
## Examples This example shows how get the `SessionKeyRolloverInterval` value.
[!code-csharp[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/cs/program.cs#14)] [!code-vb[S_UELocalServiceSecuritySettings#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelocalservicesecuritysettings/vb/program.vb#14)]

Docs.exception: The property is set to a value less than 0.

Docs.value: The maximum duration of time that messages are valid when sent by the service. The default is 5 minutes.
